intro: Bromus inermis f. pellitus, commonly known as the slender brome, is a perennial grass species native to western North America. It typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands, disturbed soils, and rocky areas. Its inflorescence consists of a single spikelet at the tip of each stem, which is often obscured by the foliage. This form is distinguished by its reduced flowering structure and is often considered a variant of the common brome, Bromus inermis.
